meanings.definition: To renounce or repudiate under oath
meanings.sent1: He forswears all allegiance to the old king.
meanings.sent2: She forswears any involvement in the crime.
meanings.sent3: The cat forswears its love for fish but secretly sneaks a bite.
meanings.sent4: The politician forswears corruption, yet his actions speak otherwise.
meanings.sent5: The knight forswears his loyalty to the evil sorcerer, choosing the path of righteousness instead.

meanings.definition: To swear falsely or commit perjury
meanings.sent1: He forswears his innocence in front of the court.
meanings.sent2: She forswears the truth to protect her friend.
meanings.sent3: The parrot forswears its usual phrases and starts mimicking the dog's bark.
meanings.sent4: The con artist forswears his guilt, but the evidence speaks against him.
meanings.sent5: The witness forswears the oath, leading to a mistrial in the case.
